intro: Alchemilla fissa subsp. glabra, commonly known as smooth lady’s mantle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in terminal clusters during late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies for skin conditions and digestive ailments.
